title.narrative: Strengthening lobbying activities and financial sustainability.

description.narrative:
1) Publish four policy papers and present at the farmers forum for enforcement

2) diversify the revenue stream of UNYFA by conducting one feasibility study 

3) conduct youth exchange focusing on market linkage and climate change. 

4) 2 agreements sighed with business champions and privates. 

5) 20 youth leaders will be trained on climate smart activities through exchange programs

The Young Farmers’ Federation of Uganda (UNYFA) was established in January 2016 and launched in June 2017 as an umbrella body for young farmers in Uganda. UNYFA is driven by desire to have a holistically transformed youth in agriculture for a sustainable economy in Uganda. It seek to ensure that young farmers are able to have their voice heard on issues that are important to them; have their views genuinely considered when decisions are being made. To streamline its future existence through a guiding document UNYFA crafted its five-year strategic plan (2018-2022). The central theme of the strategic plan is lobby and advocacy; this action plans mirrors the strategic plan. Up on implementation this AP will contribute in enabling UNYFA achieve one milestone through strategic plan journey. Secondly UNYFA is an association which is highly dependent on donor money for its existence this action plan will attempt to address the financial sustainability of UNYFA. Several Exchanges will also take place among the youth groups to introduce climate challenges and possible solutions from different climate smart programs currently running.
